text: what's the most performant way of loading a "background" video in react? Should I load it in HubSpot as a file? as an file in the assets folder?

Hey everyone and Happy Friday! Do you happen to know if there are any incompatibilities with the `<@UDA553DRD>/api-client` package?
I keep running into an error when I try to deploy on live.
Import is done like this `import { Client } from '@HubSpot/api-client';` and then it’s used like this: `const HubSpotClient = new Client({ "accessToken": ""});`
Hey George, I might be crazy but isn't that package node only? I don't think you can use it on the frontend
Hey Andrey, wow, you’re right…. Well, in this case, what would be the alternative to use the HS API to create/update objects in the CRM (contacts and company)?
I usually use serverless functions for that
or I guess you could do it using any server you have access to
I don’t have access to serverless functions, these are only for enterprise tiers. But good idea, I’ll need to use a third party server
<@U02CS2Q38QG> I'd be curious to know how you end up doing it. Like, will you use some other serverless function service or can you just spin up a server somewhere just for this?
I’ll need to think about it, but I’ll keep you informed. Any ideas on the subject are very welcome :slightly_smiling_face:
I would probably go the "external serverless function" route
like on AWS or something cheaper probably
or maybe just do it in zapier if nothing too crazy is happening

<@U02CS2Q38QG> <@UDHT6N5SM> I've been thinking about using Cloudflare Workers for these types of scenarios too, but again I'm not sure how supported POSTing data is right now, I haven't tried yet. Will try soon, let me know if you guys find some interesting solution!

We haven’t thought much about videos yet. I think you are probably better off uploading it as a separate file the HS file manager and linking/referencing its public URL.

Otherwise if you include the video asset in your project, every build you’ll be re-uploading that video to our build server _and_ re-uploading the file to our CDN every build (which will add significant time to the build)
sounds good, I'll do that, thanks

I believe another option (with some trade-offs) to create a contact from client-side JS would be to POST directly to an existing form inside the HS account via <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>

In the end, I’ll use an existing middleware made with Laravel that already has the HubSpot API integrated. I’ll send the submitted data to an endpoint from that middleware and then it will be synced with the CRM via the HubSpot API.

Another option I was considering was using another type of middleware: an instance of NextJS with pages like `api/{HubSpot-API-call}`.

Unfortunately having the serverless functions limited to the enterprise tier, limits this kind of usage. If we would have serverless functions in the professional tier it would be beneficial. For sure clients will not switch to enterprise, just for our serverless functions :smile:
Thank you, everyone, for helping! :raised_hands:
yea, 100% agree on that last part. It really should be in professional
We hear ya, thanks for the feedback!
